snippet: After watching three hours of dressage, a dance critic concludes that while the ballet-for-horses description is apt, there are still questions perhaps only a horse can answer.
abstract: Roslyn Sulcas Dance Review column concludes that while the ballet-for-horses description of dressage is apt, there are still questions perhaps only a horse can answer; observes that the art is not just the horse’s skill and precision in executing movements, but the rider’s ability to instruct solely through the subtle use of reins and leg pressure.
lead_paragraph: After watching three hours of dressage, a dance critic concludes that while the ballet-for-horses description is apt, there are still questions perhaps only a horse can answer.

headline.seo: Dressage Is Not Quite ‘Swan Lake,’ but It’s Surprisingly Close
headline.main: Not Quite ‘Swan Lake,’ but Surprisingly Close
headline.print_headline: Not Quite ‘Swan Lake,’ but Surprisingly Close
